trans-unit.target: TEXT_REGNOR4TWINE_00598_KJARTAN_000_000<tab>What brings you to Twine, if you don't mind me asking?

TEXT_REGNOR4TWINE_00598_KJARTAN_000_010<tab>Though we no longer have that wretched Light constantly glaring down upon us, precious little else has changed around here. Most of us are still living hand-to-mouth no matter how hard we work.
TEXT_REGNOR4TWINE_00598_KJARTAN_000_020<tab>So much for the return of the night sky! It was good while it lasted, I suppose. At any rate, it's all the same when you're breaking rocks in some mine.
TEXT_REGNOR4TWINE_00598_KJARTAN_000_030<tab>Is the Light gone for good this time? I bloody well hope so.
TEXT_REGNOR4TWINE_00598_KJARTAN_000_100<tab>Like most people around here, I'm a miner.
TEXT_REGNOR4TWINE_00598_KJARTAN_000_101<tab>It's all I know, and to be perfectly honest, there isn't much else <var 1A 02 /var>to<var 1A 01 /var> know in Amh Araeng.

TEXT_REGNOR4TWINE_00598_KJARTAN_000_200<tab>Not many people are aware of this─even those who live here─but Twine was built through the combined efforts of the Ronso and Mystel. The name of this town comes from the idea of their tails being entwined together.
TEXT_REGNOR4TWINE_00598_KJARTAN_000_201<tab>You don't see much cooperation between them these days, though. Most of the Mystel moved to Eulmore years ago and there are only one or two left now.
TEXT_REGNOR4TWINE_00598_KJARTAN_000_202<tab>We Ronso, on the other hand, don't give up so easily. As long as there is work to be done, we'll be here.
